title: Understanding Anosognosia
text: Anosognosia is a condition where a person is unaware of their own mental health condition or cannot perceive their condition accurately. This lack of insight is often due to the illness itself.

title: Characteristics of Anosognosia
text: Consider how a mental illness might affect a person's ability to recognize their own symptoms. Anosognosia is not just denial; it's a lack of awareness caused by the illness.

hintAnswer: when a client is unaware that they are ill because of the illness itself
title: Identifying Anosognosia
text: Which of the following best describes anosognosia?
choices: deficits in ability to think or reason
when a client is unaware that they are ill because of the illness itself

a gradual onset of nonspecific behaviors, such as sleep disturbances, suspiciousness, decreased attention to activities of daily living, disconnection with peers and family members, depressed mood, irritability, and problems focusing or understanding
